file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-50-08-04 - AISLE EMERGENCY LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL AISLE EMERGENCY LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the aisle emergency-light lamp and the aisle emergency-light assembly. B. The aisle emergency light is installed in the passenger cabin, on the headliner panel, and illuminates the aircraft aisle in an emergency condition. C. There are four aisle emergency lights installed on the aircraft. The removal/installation procedures of this section are the same for all the lights. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AISLE EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - RE- ALL 33-50-08-000-801-A MOVAL AISLE EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - IN- ALL 33-50-08-400-801-A STALLATION AISLE EMERGENCY-LIGHT ASSEMBLY - ALL 33-50-08-000-802-A REMOVAL AISLE EMERGENCY-LIGHT ASSEMBLY - ALL 33-50-08-400-802-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-50-08 Page 1 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-08-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. AISLE EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the aisle emergency-light lamp. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 243 243ALC Passenger Cabin (headliner panel) 243 243DLC Passenger Cabin (headliner panel) 253 253CLC Passenger Cabin (headliner panel) 263 263ALC Passenger Cabin (headliner panel) C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin (headliner panels) H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Carefully remove the lens (2). (2) Remove the lamp (3) from the light housing assembly (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-08 Page 2 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Aisle Emergency-Light Lamp - Removal/Installation Figure 401 ZONES 243 253 263 B A DET. A HEADLINER PANEL (REF.) 1. LIGHT HOUSING ASSEMBLY 3. LAMP 2. LENS DET. B 145AMM330178.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-08 Page 3 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-08-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. AISLE EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the aisle emergency light lamp. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500 EMERGENCY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 243 243ALC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) 243 243DLC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) 253 253CLC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) 263 263ALC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin (headliner panels) I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the lamp (3) in the light housing assembly (1). (2) Carefully install the lens (2). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-50-08 Page 4 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Do the Emergency Lighting test ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-50-08 Page 5 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-08-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. AISLE EMERGENCY-LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the aisle emergency-light assembly. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 243 243ALC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) 243 243DLC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) 253 253CLC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) 263 263ALC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin (headliner panels) H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). I. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Carefully remove the lens (2). (2) Remove the screws (3). (3) Carefully pull the light housing assembly (1) from the headliner panel. (4) Remove the screws (6) and washers (5) and (4) that attach the terminal lugs (7) to the light housing assembly (1). (5) Remove the light housing assembly (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-50-08 Page 6 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Aisle Emergency-Light Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 402 ZONES 243 253 263 A B DET. A HEADLINER PANEL (REF.) 7. TERMINAL LUG (2) 6. SCREW (2) 1. LIGHT HOUSING ASSEMBLY 5. WASHER (2 ) 3. SCREW (4) 4. WASHER (2) 2. LENS DET. B 145AMM330176.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-50-08 Page 7 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-08-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. AISLE EMERGENCY-LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the aisle emergency light assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500 EMERGENCY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 243 243ALC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) 243 243DLC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) 253 253CLC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) 263 263ALC Passenger cabin (headliner panel) D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin (headliner panels) I. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Install the screws (6) and washers (5) and (4) to attach the terminal lugs (7) to the light housing assembly (1). (2) Carefully put the light housing assembly (1) in its installation position. (3) Install the screws (3). (4) Carefully install the lens (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-50-08 Page 8 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (2) Do the Emergency Lighting test ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-50-08 Page 9 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A.
